meanings.definition: Capable of being called forth or brought to mind.
meanings.sent1: The old photograph was evocable, bringing back memories of childhood.
meanings.sent2: The music had an evocable effect on her, making her feel nostalgic.
meanings.sent3: The evocable scent of freshly baked cookies filled the room, making everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: The painting was so evocable that it seemed to come to life before our eyes.
meanings.sent5: The evocable sound of the ocean waves crashing against the shore was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: Able to evoke or elicit a response or emotion.
meanings.sent1: Her evocable words touched the hearts of everyone in the audience.
meanings.sent2: The movie had an evocable scene that made everyone cry.
meanings.sent3: The evocable joke made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The evocable melody of the song brought tears to her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The evocable story left a lasting impact on the listeners.
